thread.title: H.S. boys soccer report: Player of the year watch for Oct. 14
thread.title_full: H.S. boys soccer report: Player of the year watch for Oct. 14

title: H.S. boys soccer report: Player of the year watch for Oct. 14
text:
Buy this photo RECORD FILE PHOTO Justin Kochman had a goal and two assists when Glen Rock defeated Paramus, 3-0, in the first round of the Bergen Cup on Saturday. 
(All statistics and records are through Monday) 
Deydiry Chamba, Harrison, sophomore, F 
Chamba scored a goal in the Blue Tide’s 8-0 win over Queen of Peace on Oct. 7. Then he put in the lone marker when Harrison edged North Bergen, 1-0, in the Hudson tournament quarterfinals Saturday. On the season, he has seven goals and five assists. 
Justin Kochman, Glen Rock, sophomore, M 
Kochman had a goal and two assists when Glen Rock defeated Paramus, 3-0, in the first round of the Bergen Cup on Saturday. On the season, Kochman has seven goals and two assists. 
Carlo Gonzalez, Pompton Lakes, sophomore, F 
Gonzalez fired in both goals when the Cardinals defeated Glen Rock, 2-0, in an NJIC Colonial game Monday. On the season, Gonzalez leads Pompton Lakes with 10 goals and has three assists. 
Rene White, Hawthorne Christian, senior, F 
White, a returning first team All-North Jersey player, scored three goals in a 7-0 win over Palisades Park in the NJIC Patriot on Oct. 7. He had two assists when Hawthorne Christian defeated Passaic, 3-1, in a Passaic tournament quarterfinal Saturday. On the season, White has 19 goals and 10 assists. 
Cristiano Neves, North Arlington, junior, F 
Neves scored the lone North Arlington goal when the Vikings were edged, 2-1, by Mahwah in a Bergen tournament play-in game Thursday. The highly effective striker had two goals and an assist in a 6-0 win over Paterson Charter on Friday. On the season, he has 18 goals and seven assists. © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
